data.title: F-Stop Collaborate and Listen Podcast
data.meta_description: F-Stop Collaborate and Listen - A Landscape and Nature Photography Podcast
data.text:
The photography podcast hosted by Matt Payne. Candid conversations with photographers, industry insiders, and other artists on the craft of nature & landscape photography. Each week we release a new episode with a guest or panel and talk about psychological drivers in landscape photography, social media, business, marketing, motivation, inspiration, workflow, and more. If you are a well-established photographer or someone with something interesting to say and are interested in becoming a guest on the podcast, please pitch your idea here. If you'd like to stay up-to-date on the latest episodes, please consider signing up for our mailing list!

How to Listen to or Watch the F-Stop Collaborate and Listen Podcast

The podcast is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts, Pandora, and YouTube. You can read more details about each podcast episode, find links to the topics discussed on the episode, a searchable transcript, and sample photographs from the artist in our show notes for each episode. We also have an Instagram page and a Facebook page and a Facebook Group for updates.

Support the Podcast

F-Stop Collaborate and Listen is an independent, ad-free, listener supported production.

This value-for-value business model keeps the podcast accountable only to you, instead of to the companies who pay for advertisements. This business model also represents a refusal to sell your valuable time. At F-Stop Collaborate and Listen, you are the valued customer, not the product to be sold to the highest bidder.

This business model functions on the honor system and so if you have found value in this podcast, please contribute to make sure it can continue to inform and entertain you for many years to come.

Please consider supporting the podcast. There are a variety of ways to support the podcast.

All financial contributors get a verbal thank you on an episode and if requested, will have a short message read on-air.

You can contribute to the Podcast via Patreon, PayPal or Venmo.

Patreon supporters get special access to bonus episodes, early releases, and a lot more.

You can also contribute on a regular basis via PayPal if you prefer:

Payment Options

Or you can make one-time donations via PayPal:

You can also support the podcast by shopping on B&H or Amazon through our B+H affiliate link or our Amazon link. Keep that in mind for your future photography purchases. Your support is greatly appreciated!

We also have a limited supply of t-shirts available for purchase!

Thanks to our Producers who contribute $20 or more per month for helping to keep the podcast running through their generous support on Patreon. One of the key tenets of the podcast is that we want to support other photographers and collaborate with them. Please support them generously if you can:

Anton Averin

We are a huge supporter of Nature Photographer's Network, the internet's premier community for landscape and nature photographers. By signing up to NPN, you not only help the podcast, but you gain access to amazing discounts on gear, tutorials, and software while joining a huge community of awesome people who love this stuff just like us! Click on the link to join us!

What is the Best Landscape and Nature Photography Podcast?

When I set out to create this podcast in 2017, my goal was simple - I wanted to create something that other photographers like me would love to listen to on a weekly basis. I wanted to provide a platform for stimulating photographer's imaginations, inspiring them to learn new techniques and approaches to making landscape and nature photography images, and to develop a community where we can showcase some of the best and often hidden talent that can be found in the nature and landscape photography space. The journey has been quite the ride and I had a rough start; however, I believe that this podcast is simply the best landscape and nature photography podcast that exists on planet earth. There are countless podcasts that have tried to copy what I am doing here; however, I think I've set the standard for what makes an interesting, informative, entertaining, and thought-provoking landscape photography podcast. If you don't believe me, see a small handful of our reviews on Apple Podcasts:
